content:
I would like to discuss the stabilization of unix_socket_creation, tracking issue: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93423.

I know it's been barely a month, but the function existed in std lib before it being made public (see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93239). Furthermore similar functions exists in at least in the Mio and Socket2 crates. This is one of few blocking issues for Mio v1 and I would love Mio v1 to be able to run on rust 1.60 stable.

Yeah, I don't think we need to wait long before stabilizing that. There's just one unresolved question on the tracking issue:

Name it from_pathname to match as_pathname?
there seem to be a good reason for that rename, and nobody seems opposed to it so far.
@Thomas de Zeeuw if you are also not opposed to that rename, feel free to open a PR that both renames it and stabilizes it, then I'll kick off the FCP on that PR.
note that nightly is already at 1.61. we could consider a beta backport if there's a good reason to have it in 1.60.
That unfortunate, I don't really have a good reason to backport it, other then it's small.
if it's the only thing blocking mio v1 on 1.60, that might be a good reason.
That's true, the other issues (https://github.com/tokio-rs/mio/milestone/4) are not std related
I'd prefer not to set a precedent for backporting enhancements, however trivial. We have a fast release train, everyone gets to ride it.
agreed, stabilize it but let it ride the trains, mio's been pre-1.0 since before Rust 1.0, adding six weeks to that doesn't seem too onerous :)
